title: Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra
summary: Vacuums, mops, empties itself, and washes its own pads. Saves ~4 hours/week of cleaning.
content:
The Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra is the closest thing to hiring a cleaning service without actually hiring one. It vacuums carpets with 6000Pa suction, mops hard floors with a vibrating pad, and when it's done, it returns to its dock to empty the dustbin, wash the mop pads, and dry them with hot air.

The obstacle avoidance uses a camera plus structured light, so it dodges shoes, cables, and pet toys without getting stuck. You can set room-specific cleaning schedules and no-mop zones through the app. It even lifts the mop pad when it detects carpet.

Is it expensive? Yes. But if you value your time at anything above minimum wage, it pays for itself within months. Four hours a week of cleaning, reclaimed. That's 200+ hours a year you get back for things that actually matter.
